item.title: Further flytipping, 4th September
item.description:
There’s been regular dumping of household rubbish at this location. The problem seems to be getting worse, with new rubbish appearing regularly. Would it be possible to arrange for the current waste to be cleared? More importantly, I’d really appreciate your thoughts on preventing this from continuing. Perhaps some signage about penalties for fly-tipping, increased patrols, or even CCTV if that’s feasible? I know other areas have had success with these approaches. This location seems to attract repeat offenders, so I think we need something more robust than just periodic clean-ups. I’m happy to provide any additional information that might help, including photos or times when I’ve noticed fresh dumping.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 336, East Street, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog fouling on the pavement, 4th September
item.description:
